column4: If windows nor ubuntu can use the card despite correct drivers installed, there is the chance the card could be bad
Which card model do you have?
What version of ubuntu?
How did you install the driver?
Well you probably want to remove that by running the uninstall script in /usr/share/ati and install instead via sys>admin>hardware drivers
Your other option is to install the latest open driver packages which will give you 3D acceleration
is it suitable for day-to-day use already? Are we talking about radeonhd?
No, you don't want radeonhd for the open driver. You want radeon

rumpsy: 1) Look at the output of 'dpkg -l|grep fglrx' and remove any packages with 'ii' next to them 2) Run this to install latest open driver packages 'sudo apt-add-repository ppa:xorg-edgers/ppa && sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade' 3) Rename, move or remove /etc/X1//xorg.conf 4) Reboot.
Yes, the open driver has 3D for that card now
How did you install fglrx?
with --buildpkg Ubuntu/jautny
Why did you not use the hardware drivers manager designed for installing fglrx correctly?
I want tu use a recent version, for better dual-head support.
Why would you think that a newer version has better dual head support?
fglrx has sucked for years. If you get it working any other way than jockey (sys>admin>hardware drivers) you are fortunate. Otherwise, you're on your own
Because it does. I can use my dvd player as a second monitor right now, but I couldn't with 9.8 or 9.6

Well your driver installation is broken. I recommend you uninstall the driver (hint: look for an uninstall script in /usr/share/ati) and reinstall the drivers the correct way using the hardware driver manager
You other option is to remove all versions of fglrx and use the open driver by installing packages from the xorg-edgers repo and using a latest kernel from ppa
do they have 3D for HD2600XT?
Yes, I told you that like 3 hours ago
